thig13.5:0.3: Subhā, the Daughter of a Blacksmith
thig13.5:1.1: “In the past, when I was young and living a pure life,
thig13.5:1.4: there was realization of the truth.
thig13.5:2.1: Because of this I was extremely dissatisfied
thig13.5:2.3: Having seen the danger in self-identity,
thig13.5:3.1: I have abandoned the company of relatives,
thig13.5:4.1: I have given up much wealth
thig13.5:4.2: for the sake of going forth.
thig13.5:4.3: Thus I have left the household life
thig13.5:4.4: out of faith in the well-spoken true Dhamma.
thig13.5:5.2: for anyone who wished for no posessions.
thig13.5:5.3: To come back to gold and silver
thig13.5:6.2: is not for enlightenment nor for peace.
thig13.5:6.3: This isn't proper for a contemplative,
thig13.5:7.3: It is unreliable, brings much trouble,
thig13.5:7.4: and its duration is not long.
thig13.5:9.3: Those who are engaged in sensual pleasures
thig13.5:9.4: can be seen to be afflicted with much misfortune.
thig13.5:10.2: why do you try to lure me with sensual pleasures?
thig13.5:10.3: You know I have gone forth
thig13.5:10.4: seeing the danger in sensual pleasures.
thig13.5:11.2: are the corruptions of mind eliminated.
thig13.5:12.2: why do you try to lure me with sensual pleasures?
thig13.5:12.3: You know I have gone forth
thig13.5:12.4: with a shaven head, wrapped in the outer robe.
thig13.5:13.2: a robe made from discarded rags:
thig13.5:13.3: that indeed is proper for me,
thig13.5:13.4: the support for the homeless life.
thig13.5:14.1: Sensual pleasures, both divine or human,
thig13.5:14.2: have been spewed out by the great sages.
thig13.5:14.3: They are in the safe place, liberated,
thig13.5:15.1: I should not get involved with sensual pleasures,
thig13.5:15.4: they are like a great mass of fire, they are suffering.
thig13.5:16.1: This greed is an obstacle, dreadful,
thig13.5:16.3: it is the opposite of peace,
thig13.5:17.2: sensual pleasures are like a snake's head,
thig13.5:18.1: Indeed there are many foolish beings in the world,
thig13.5:18.2: trapped in the mud of sensual pleasures.
thig13.5:18.3: They do not know the end
thig13.5:19.2: humans are on the path that leads to a bad destination.
thig13.5:20.4: sensual pleasures bind us to death.
thig13.5:21.3: For the defilement of sentient beings,
thig13.5:21.4: they are a trap set by Māra.
thig13.5:22.3: They bring little enjoyment, they produce conflict,
thig13.5:22.4: causing one's bright wholesome traits to wither away.
thig13.5:23.3: I will not go back to it.
thig13.5:24.2: I longed for a state of coolness,
thig13.5:24.4: in the destruction of all fetters.
thig13.5:25.4: the one because of which the great sage crossed over."
thig13.5:26.1: "You see this person established in Dhamma,
thig13.5:26.2: Subhā, the daughter of a blacksmith.
thig13.5:26.4: she meditates at the root of a tree.
thig13.5:27.1: Today is the eighth day since her going forth,
thig13.5:27.2: faith shining in the true Dhamma.
thig13.5:27.4: possessing three superhuman knowledges, leaving behind death.
thig13.5:28.1: A free person with no debt,
thig13.5:28.4: one who has done what was to be done, free from corruptions."
thig13.5:29.1: Then Sakka with an assembly of Devas,
thig13.5:29.3: the lord of beings pays homage to
thig13.5:29.4: Subhā, the daughter of a blacksmith.
thig13.5:30.2: The Elder Subhā, daughter of a blacksmith.
thig13.5:31.1: The Chapter of the Twenties is finished.
